page.title: 19LODGE FARM AND POLAND FARM
page.content: The area east of the M3 Junction is mainly farmland, growing crops other than grass. A variety of crops are grown including market garden produce. There are fields of wheat and corn, early potatoes, cabbages and carrots. At Lodge Farm, customers are invited to pick their own soft fruit, potatoes and vegetables. The secondary land cover is deciduous woodland. The remaining area is intensively managed grassland. Cows reared indoors are fed on hay. Near the River Whitewater the land is wet and boggy. The primary land cover near Poland Farm is farmland, growing cereal crops The secondary cover is enclosed rough grazing land. There are some houses in the area. A regular bus service to Camberley covers the area around these two farms.
